services.name: CreditAI: AI-Powered Microfinance Credit Scoring
services.overview: CreditAI is a platform designed to revolutionize credit scoring and risk assessment within microfinance institutions (MFIs). Recognizing the limitations of traditional credit scoring models in regions with limited formal credit history, CreditAI leverages machine learning to analyze a diverse range of alternative data sources, including social media activity, mobile usage patterns, transaction history, and agricultural data. This comprehensive approach provides a more accurate and nuanced assessment of an applicant's creditworthiness, enabling MFIs to reduce default rates, increase loan approval rates for deserving borrowers, and automate the credit scoring process. CreditAI aims to democratize access to microfinance by offering a fair and data-driven alternative to traditional credit checks, particularly benefiting individuals and small businesses in underserved communities. The platform incorporates advanced AI models to continuously learn and adapt to changing economic conditions and borrower behavior, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of credit scores over time. Furthermore, CreditAI provides a user-friendly interface for loan officers to easily access and interpret credit scores, supporting informed decision-making and efficient loan processing.
problems_addressed: High default rates due to inaccurate risk assessment based on limited formal credit history.
Exclusion of deserving applicants from accessing microfinance loans due to reliance on traditional credit scoring methods.
Inefficient and time-consuming manual credit scoring processes for loan officers.
Lack of comprehensive data on borrowers, hindering accurate risk assessment.
Difficulty in adapting to changing economic conditions and borrower behavior.
target_users: Credit Risk Managers at Microfinance Institutions
core_features: AI-Powered Credit Scoring – Leverages machine learning algorithms to analyze alternative data sources (social media, mobile usage, transaction history, agricultural data) and generate a comprehensive credit score.
Alternative Data Integration – Seamlessly integrates with various data sources, including mobile network operators, social media platforms, mobile money providers, and agricultural databases.
Customizable Risk Models – Allows MFIs to customize risk models based on their specific lending criteria and target demographics.
User-Friendly Interface – Provides a clear and intuitive interface for loan officers to access and interpret credit scores, simplifying the loan approval process.
Automated Loan Application Processing – Automates the credit scoring process, reducing manual effort and accelerating loan approvals.
Real-time Monitoring and Reporting – Provides real-time monitoring of loan portfolio performance and generates detailed reports on credit risk trends.
Fraud Detection – Identifies potentially fraudulent loan applications based on patterns and anomalies in the data.
user_journeys: A loan officer logs into the CreditAI platform using their credentials.
The loan officer enters the applicant's personal information (name, contact details, location).
The system automatically retrieves and analyzes data from integrated sources (social media, mobile usage, transaction history, agricultural databases).
The AI model generates a credit score based on the analyzed data.
The loan officer reviews the credit score and associated risk factors.
The loan officer uses the credit score and other relevant information to make an informed loan approval decision.
The loan officer updates the loan application status in the system.
ai_capabilities: Machine learning model for credit scoring: A classification model (e.g., Random Forest, Gradient Boosting) trained on historical loan data and alternative data sources to predict the probability of loan default.
Natural Language Processing (NLP) for social media analysis: Analyzes text data from social media to extract relevant information about the applicant's financial behavior and reputation.
Feature engineering: Automatically identifies and extracts relevant features from the alternative data sources to improve the accuracy of the credit scoring model.
Model selection: Use GridSearchCV or similar techniques to fine-tune and select the best performing model.
OpenAI models: Consider OpenAI embeddings for encoding unstructured data like social media posts. Can use GPT models for sentiment analysis if needed.
Vector search: Use Pinecone or Supabase vectors to store user embeddings for similarity searches (e.g., identify similar borrowers).
Fine-tuning: Fine-tune the model with regional or institution-specific data for better results.

input_data_types: Applicant's personal information (name, contact details, location)
Mobile usage data (call logs, SMS history, mobile money transactions)
Social media activity (posts, comments, network connections)
Agricultural data (crop yields, livestock ownership, land size)
data_schema_recommendations: Applicants Table: applicant_id (INT, Primary Key), name (VARCHAR), contact_details (VARCHAR), location (VARCHAR)
MobileUsage Table: applicant_id (INT, Foreign Key referencing Applicants), call_logs (TEXT), sms_history (TEXT), mobile_money_transactions (TEXT)
SocialMedia Table: applicant_id (INT, Foreign Key referencing Applicants), posts (TEXT), comments (TEXT), network_connections (TEXT)
Transactions Table: applicant_id (INT, Foreign Key referencing Applicants), bank_statements (TEXT), utility_bills (TEXT)
AgriculturalData Table: applicant_id (INT, Foreign Key referencing Applicants), crop_yields (TEXT), livestock_ownership (TEXT), land_size (TEXT)
Scores Table: applicant_id (INT, Foreign Key referencing Applicants), credit_score (FLOAT), risk_factors (JSON)
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Compliance with local data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and ethical considerations regarding the use of alternative data sources. Secure data storage and encryption to protect applicant privacy.

integration_plan.authentication_strategy: JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for secure API authentication and authorization. OAuth for social media platform integrations. Clerk for user management and authentication.

technical_specifications.architecture: Multi-tiered architecture comprising a frontend user interface, a backend API layer, a database for data storage, and an AI pipeline for credit scoring. The frontend interacts with the backend API to retrieve and display credit scores. The backend API orchestrates data retrieval, model execution, and data storage. The AI pipeline is responsible for training, deploying, and monitoring the machine learning models.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes (see data_schema_recommendations)
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob for storing large data files (e.g., images, documents)
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API, embeddings, vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors), Python (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch)
recommended_tech_stack.APIs: REST APIs for communication between frontend and backend

API_design: GET /applicants/{applicant_id} – Retrieves applicant details and credit score.
POST /applicants – Creates a new applicant and initiates credit scoring.
GET /scores/{applicant_id} – Retrieves the credit score for a specific applicant.
POST /feedback – Allows loan officers to provide feedback on the accuracy of credit scores.
frontend_components: ApplicantForm – A form for entering applicant details.
CreditScoreCard – A card displaying the applicant's credit score and risk factors.
DataSourcesPanel – A panel displaying the data sources used to generate the credit score.
LoanApprovalDecision – A component for recording the loan approval decision.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables needed: OPENAI_API_KEY, DB_URL, SOCIAL_MEDIA_API_KEYs, MOBILE_MONEY_API_KEYs, SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY.
Steps for Vercel deployment: 1. Create a Vercel account. 2. Connect your GitHub repository to Vercel. 3. Configure environment variables in Vercel. 4. Deploy the application.
Build outputs and runtime settings: Node.js runtime for the backend, Next.js build output for the frontend.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers based on the number of loan applications processed per month.
Usage-based pricing based on the number of API calls to the credit scoring service.
Custom pricing for enterprise clients with specific requirements.

success_metrics: Loan approval rate increase for deserving applicants
